title: Theorems requiring subset and intersection existence

blocks.name: nalset
blocks.content: No set contains all sets. Theorem 41 of [Suppes] p. 30. (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.) Remove use of ~ ax-12 and ~ ax-13 . (Revised by BJ, 31-May-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm nalset(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wn(wex(s0, wal(s1, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpgbi(s0, wn(wex(s0, wal(s1, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s1, wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  alexn(s0, s1, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  eximii(s1, wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wal(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))))
  ax-sep(s1, hs0, s0, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))
  syl(wal(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))))), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1))))))
  spvv(hs0, s1, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))))), wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1))))))
  bibi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)))))
  elequ1(hs0, s1, s1)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1))))
  elequ1(hs0, s1, s0)
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)))
  bitrd(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  elequ1(hs0, s1, hs0)
  elequ2(hs0, s1, s1)
  pclem6(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s1))))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nalset(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ⊢ ¬ ∃(s0, ∀(s1, s1 ∈ s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpgbi(s0, ¬ ∃(s0, ∀(s1, s1 ∈ s0)), ∃(s1, ¬ s1 ∈ s0))
  alexn(s0, s1, s1 ∈ s0)
  eximii(s1, ¬ s1 ∈ s0, ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ s1 ↔(hs0 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0))))
  ax-sep(s1, hs0, s0, ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0)
  syl(∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ s1 ↔(hs0 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0))), ¬ s1 ∈ s0, (s1 ∈ s1 ↔(s1 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ s1 ∈ s1)))
  spvv(hs0, s1, (hs0 ∈ s1 ↔(hs0 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0)), (s1 ∈ s1 ↔(s1 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ s1 ∈ s1)))
  bibi12d(hs0 = s1, hs0 ∈ s1, (hs0 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0), s1 ∈ s1, (s1 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ s1 ∈ s1))
  elequ1(hs0, s1, s1)
  anbi12d(hs0 = s1, hs0 ∈ s0, ¬ hs0 ∈ hs0, s1 ∈ s0, ¬ s1 ∈ s1)
  elequ1(hs0, s1, s0)
  notbid(hs0 = s1, hs0 ∈ hs0, s1 ∈ s1)
  bitrd(hs0 = s1, hs0 ∈ hs0, s1 ∈ s1, s1 ∈ hs0)
  elequ1(hs0, s1, hs0)
  elequ2(hs0, s1, s1)
  pclem6(s1 ∈ s1, s1 ∈ s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, hs0 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, hs0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, hs0 ∈ hs0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w((s1 ∈ s1 ↔(s1 ∈ s0 ∧ ¬ s1 ∈ s1)))
}

blocks.name: vnex
blocks.content: The universal class does not exist as a set. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jul-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm vnex(setvar s0) {
  |- wn(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), universe)))
} = {
  mtbi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), universe)), wex(s0, wal(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))
  nalset(s0, hs0)
  exbii(s0, wal(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), universe))
  bitr4i(wal(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), universe), wal(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))))
  albii(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe)))
  tbt(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  dfcleq(hs0, cv(s0), universe)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm vnex(setvar s0) {
  ⊢ ¬ ∃(s0, s0 = 𝕌)
} = {
  mtbi(∃(s0, s0 = 𝕌), ∃(s0, ∀(hs0, hs0 ∈ s0)))
  nalset(s0, hs0)
  exbii(s0, ∀(hs0, hs0 ∈ s0), s0 = 𝕌)
  bitr4i(∀(hs0, hs0 ∈ s0), s0 = 𝕌, ∀(hs0,(hs0 ∈ s0 ↔ hs0 ∈ 𝕌)))
  albii(hs0, hs0 ∈ s0, (hs0 ∈ s0 ↔ hs0 ∈ 𝕌))
  tbt(hs0 ∈ s0, hs0 ∈ 𝕌)
  vex(hs0)
  dfcleq(hs0, s0, universe)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
}

blocks.name: vprc
blocks.content: The universal class is not a member of itself (and thus is not a set). Proposition 5.21 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 21; our proof, however, does not depend on the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: nvel
blocks.content: The universal class does not belong to any class. (Contributed by FL, 31-Dec-2006.)

blocks.name: inex1
blocks.content: Separation Scheme (Aussonderung) using class notation. Compare Exercise 4 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 22. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm inex1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
} = {
  issetri(hs0, cin(c0, c1))
  mpbir(wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c1))), wex(hs0, wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))))))
  zfauscl(hs0, hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  exbii(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c1)), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))))
  bitri(wceq(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c1)), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))), wal(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c1)))))
  dfcleq(hs1, cv(hs0), cin(c0, c1))
  albii(hs1, wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c1))), wb(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))))
  bibi2i(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))
  elin(cv(hs1), c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.c(cin(c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm inex1(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⋂ c1)∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  issetri(hs0, (c0 ⋂ c1))
  mpbir(∃(hs0, hs0 =(c0 ⋂ c1)), ∃(hs0, ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)))))
  zfauscl(hs0, hs1, c0, hs1 ∈ c1)
  exbii(hs0, hs0 =(c0 ⋂ c1), ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1))))
  bitri(hs0 =(c0 ⋂ c1), ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1))), ∀(hs1,(hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔ hs1 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1))))
  dfcleq(hs1, hs0, (c0 ⋂ c1))
  albii(hs1, (hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔ hs1 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1)), (hs1 ∈ hs0 ↔(hs1 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)))
  bibi2i(hs1 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈(c0 ⋂ c1), (hs1 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1))
  elin(hs1, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c((c0 ⋂ c1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(hs1 ∈ c1)
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c((c0 ⋂ c1))
}

blocks.name: inex2
blocks.content: Separation Scheme (Aussonderung) using class notation. (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: inex1g
blocks.content: Closed-form, generalized Separation Scheme. (Contributed by NM, 7-Apr-1995.)

blocks.name: ssex
blocks.content: The subset of a set is also a set. Exercise 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 22. This is one way to express the Axiom of Separation ~ ax-sep (a.k.a. Subset Axiom). (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: ssexi
blocks.content: The subset of a set is also a set. (Contributed by NM, 9-Sep-1993.)

blocks.name: ssexg
blocks.content: The subset of a set is also a set. Exercise 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 22 (generalized). (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.)

blocks.name: ssexd
blocks.content: A subclass of a set is a set. Deduction form of ~ ssexg . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: prcssprc
blocks.content: The superclass of a proper class is a proper class. (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: sselpwd
blocks.content: Elementhood to a power set. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 18-May-2020.)

blocks.name: difexg
blocks.content: Existence of a difference. (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1998.)

blocks.name: difexi
blocks.content: Existence of a difference, inference version of ~ difexg . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Mar-2021.) (Revised by AV, 26-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: zfausab
blocks.content: Separation Scheme (Aussonderung) in terms of a class abstraction. (Contributed by NM, 8-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: rabexg
blocks.content: Separation Scheme in terms of a restricted class abstraction. (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-1999.)

blocks.name: rabex
blocks.content: Separation Scheme in terms of a restricted class abstraction. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jul-1996.)

blocks.name: rabexd
blocks.content: Separation Scheme in terms of a restricted class abstraction, deduction form of ~ rabex2 . (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: rabex2
blocks.content: Separation Scheme in terms of a restricted class abstraction. (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2019.) (Revised by AV, 26-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: rab2ex
blocks.content: A class abstraction based on a class abstraction based on a set is a set. (Contributed by AV, 16-Jul-2019.) (Revised by AV, 26-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: elssabg
blocks.content: Membership in a class abstraction involving a subset. Unlike ~ elabg , ` A ` does not have to be a set. (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm elssabg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wa(wss(c2, c0), w1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wa(wss(c2, c0), w1)), wi(wa(wss(c2, c0), w1), wcel(c2, universe)))
  adantrd(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, c0), w1, wcel(c2, universe))
  expcom(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, c0), wcel(c2, universe))
  ssexg(c2, c0, c1)
  elab3g(s0, c2, universe, wa(wss(c2, c0), w1), wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wss(cv(s0), c0), w0, wss(c2, c0), w1)
  sseq1(cv(s0), c2, c0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wss(c2, c0), w1)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c2, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm elssabg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c2 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ⊆ c0 ∧ w0)} ↔(c2 ⊆ c0 ∧ w1)))
  ⊣ (s0 = c2 →(w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w1)
} = {
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ { s0 |(s0 ⊆ c0 ∧ w0)} ↔(c2 ⊆ c0 ∧ w1)), ((c2 ⊆ c0 ∧ w1)→ c2 ∈ 𝕌))
  adantrd(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ⊆ c0, w1, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  expcom(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ⊆ c0, c2 ∈ 𝕌)
  ssexg(c2, c0, c1)
  elab3g(s0, c2, universe, (c2 ⊆ c0 ∧ w1), (s0 ⊆ c0 ∧ w0))
  anbi12d(s0 = c2, s0 ⊆ c0, w0, c2 ⊆ c0, w1)
  sseq1(s0, c2, c0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c2 ⊆ c0, w1)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c2, c0)
}

blocks.name: intex
blocks.content: The intersection of a nonempty class exists. Exercise 5 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 44 and its converse. (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-2002.)
blocks.origin:
thm intex(class c0) {
  |- wb(wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cint(c0), universe))
} = {
  impbii(wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cint(c0), universe))
  sylbi(wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cint(c0), universe), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  n0(hs0, c0)
  exlimiv(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cint(c0), universe))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cint(c0), universe), wss(cint(c0), cv(hs0)))
  intss1(cv(hs0), c0)
  ssex(cint(c0), cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  necon2ai(c0, emptycls, wcel(cint(c0), universe))
  mtbiri(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(cint(c0), universe), wcel(universe, universe))
  vprc()
  eleq1d(cint(c0), universe, universe, wceq(c0, emptycls))
  syl6eq(cint(c0), universe, cint(emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  inteq(c0, emptycls)
  int0()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cint(c0), universe))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm intex(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ≠ ∅ ↔ ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  impbii(c0 ≠ ∅, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylbi(c0 ≠ ∅, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c0))
  n0(hs0, c0)
  exlimiv(hs0, hs0 ∈ c0, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl(hs0 ∈ c0, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋂ c0 ⊆ hs0)
  intss1(hs0, c0)
  ssex(⋂ c0, hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  necon2ai(c0, emptycls, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  mtbiri(c0 = ∅, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, 𝕌 ∈ 𝕌)
  vprc()
  eleq1d(⋂ c0, universe, universe, c0 = ∅)
  syl6eq(⋂ c0, universe, ⋂ ∅, c0 = ∅)
  inteq(c0, emptycls)
  int0()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
}

blocks.name: intnex
blocks.content: If a class intersection is not a set, it must be the universe. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jul-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm intnex(class c0) {
  |- wb(wn(wcel(cint(c0), universe)), wceq(cint(c0), universe))
} = {
  impbii(wn(wcel(cint(c0), universe)), wceq(cint(c0), universe))
  sylbi(wn(wcel(cint(c0), universe)), wceq(cint(c0), universe), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  necon1bbii(c0, emptycls, wcel(cint(c0), universe))
  intex(c0)
  syl6eq(cint(c0), universe, cint(emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  inteq(c0, emptycls)
  int0()
  mtbiri(wceq(cint(c0), universe), wcel(cint(c0), universe), wcel(universe, universe))
  vprc()
  eleq1(cint(c0), universe, universe)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm intnex(class c0) {
  ⊢ (¬ ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌 ↔ ⋂ c0 = 𝕌)
} = {
  impbii(¬ ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋂ c0 = 𝕌)
  sylbi(¬ ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋂ c0 = 𝕌, c0 = ∅)
  necon1bbii(c0, emptycls, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  intex(c0)
  syl6eq(⋂ c0, universe, ⋂ ∅, c0 = ∅)
  inteq(c0, emptycls)
  int0()
  mtbiri(⋂ c0 = 𝕌, ⋂ c0 ∈ 𝕌, 𝕌 ∈ 𝕌)
  vprc()
  eleq1(⋂ c0, universe, universe)
}

blocks.name: intexab
blocks.content: The intersection of a nonempty class abstraction exists. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: intexrab
blocks.content: The intersection of a nonempty restricted class abstraction exists. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: iinexg
blocks.content: The existence of a class intersection. ` x ` is normally a free-variable parameter in ` B ` , which should be read ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by FL, 19-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm iinexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))), wcel(ciin(s0, c0, c1), universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(ciin(s0, c0, c1), universe, cint(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))), wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))))
  adantl(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(ciin(s0, c0, c1), cint(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))))
  dfiin2g(s0, hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  sylib(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))), wcel(cint(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))), universe), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))), emptycls))
  sylibr(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))), emptycls), wex(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  sylib(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2))), wex(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))), wrex(s0, c0, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  imp(wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  sylib(wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))), wrex(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))))
  mpan2(wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))), wral(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))))
  rgenw(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  elisset(hs0, c1, c2)
  r19.2z(s0, c0, wi(wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  r19.35(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  rexcom4(s0, hs0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  abn0(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  intex(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: intabs
blocks.content: Absorption of a redundant conjunct in the intersection of a class abstraction. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jul-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm intabs(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wceq(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s0, w0)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cint(cab(s1, w1))), wb(w0, w2))
  -| wa(wss(cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0), w2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  eqssi(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s0, w0)))
  sseqtr4i(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s0, w0)), cint(cab(s1, w1)))
  pm2.61i(wss(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s1, w1))), wcel(cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe))
  intmin3(s0, cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0), wa(wss(cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0), w2))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cint(cab(s1, w1))), wss(cv(s0), c0), w0, wss(cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0), w2)
  sseq1(cv(s0), cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0)
  sylbi(wn(wcel(cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe)), wss(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s1, w1))), wceq(cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe))
  intnex(cab(s1, w1))
  mpbiri(wceq(cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe), wss(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), cint(cab(s1, w1))), wss(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))), universe))
  ssv(cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  sseq2(cint(cab(s1, w1)), universe, cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0))))
  inteqi(cab(s0, w0), cab(s1, w1))
  cbvabv(s0, s1, w0, w1)
  ax-mp(wss(cint(cab(s0, w0)), cint(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)))), wss(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cab(s0, w0)))
  ss2abi(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0), w0)
  simpr(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)
  intss(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cab(s0, w0))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wss(cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0), w2)
  diff.wss.s(s0, cint(cab(s1, w1)), c0)
  diff.cint.s(s0, cab(s1, w1))
  diff.cab.s(s0, s1, w1)
}

blocks.name: inuni
blocks.content: The intersection of a union ` U. A ` with a class ` B ` is equal to the union of the intersections of each element of ` A ` with ` B ` . (Contributed by FL, 24-Mar-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm inuni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cin(cuni(c0), c1), cuni(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cin(cuni(c0), c1), cuni(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))))
  bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cuni(c0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)))))), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cuni(c0), c1)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wa(wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  anbi1i(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  eluni2(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  elin(cv(hs0), cuni(c0), c1)
  bitri(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))), wa(wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s1, c0, wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  bitr4i(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))), wrex(s1, c0, wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  exbii(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)))), wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))
  bitr4i(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)))), wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wa(wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))
  ancom(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))
  r19.41v(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  rexcom4(s1, s0, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))
  bitri(wrex(s1, c0, wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))), wa(wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s1, c0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  rexbii(s1, c0, wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  bitri(wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cv(s1), c1)))
  ceqsexv(s0, cin(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cv(s1), c1)))
  inex1(cv(s1), c1)
  vex(s1)
  eleq2(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1), cv(hs0))
  elin(cv(hs0), cv(s1), c1)
  r19.41v(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  eluniab(s0, cv(hs0), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))
  diff.hs0.c(cin(cuni(c0), c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), cin(cv(s1), c1))))))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cin(cv(s1), c1))
  diff.cin.s(s0, cv(s1), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(hs0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: elpw2g
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. Theorem 86 of [Suppes] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-2000.)

blocks.name: elpw2
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. Theorem 86 of [Suppes] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-2007.)

blocks.name: elpwi2
blocks.content: Membership in a power class. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: pwnss
blocks.content: The power set of a set is never a subset. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: pwne
blocks.content: No set equals its power set. The sethood antecedent is necessary; compare ~ pwv . (Contributed by NM, 17-Nov-2008.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2016.)
